comment._content: junior infantry officer? I'm guessing he didn't make it.

comment.author: 92149915@N08
comment._content: His cap badge appears to be that of the 1st Battalion Coldstream Guards

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Second Lieutenant J C Alexander was given precedence in rank from 1st June 1916 wef 28th August 1917 (published in the London Gazette of 28th August 1917).  He completed his military service in the rank of Captain in the Coldstream Guards.  Born on 15th July 1897, he will not have been permitted to go on active service until mid-July 1916.  He was educated at Eton.  His mother was Lady Emily Harriet Catherine Boyle, eldest daughter of the 9th Earl of Cork, briefly Liberal MP for Frome in Somerset, 1854-56, and later Speaker of the House of Lords and Master of the House.

James Cedric Alexander was the youngest of four children.  His older brother, Ulick, was commissioned into the Coldstream in 1909, also survived the 14-18 war, was mentioned in despatches and awarded an OBE in 1919.  He then pursued a distinguished career as a diplomat and Royal equerry in Africa, culminating in a Knighthood.

It would appear that James Cedric Alexander did not marry.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Richard Boyle, 9th Earl of Cork, was appointed one of the speakers of the House of Lords in 1882.  He was appointed Master of the Horse (not House) by Queen Victoria in 1886.  See Wikipedia article.

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
If James Cedric Alexander was born on 15 July 1897 then he carries another initial.
James C.S. Alexander was born in St George, Hanover Sq, London, regd.  in the 3rd Qr. 1897 (FreeBMD.org.uk).  James C.S. Alexander died in Bath, regd. in the 3rd Qr. 1957 aged 60 (FreeBMD.org.uk)

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content:
1911 Census
James Cedric St Lawrence Alexander, age 13, was living with his parents and sister, plus four maids in Oakbank, Seal, Sevenoaks, Kent.
James Dalison Alexander 65
Emily Harriet Catherine Alexander 56 (25-year marriage, 3 of 4 children living)
Jacqueline Harriet Alexander 18

comment.author: 62508825@N00
comment._content: Sir James Ulick Francis Canning Alexander (Feb. 10, 1889 - Apr. 4, 1973) Eduicated Eton and Sandhurst. He fought in the First World War between 1915 and 1921, attached to the Egyptian Army, and was mentioned in despatches. OBE awarded 1919 etc. See www.findagrave.com
